newsitem.title: UK: RUGBY UNION-Wallabies look set to lose Little, Brial.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-Wallabies look set to lose Little, Brial.

text.p: The Wallabies began the Scottish leg of their European tour with a 47-20 victory over Scotland A on Wednesday, but look set to lose Jason Little and Michael Brial for a significant period.
Centre Little sustained a knee injury and flanker Brial was taken to hospital for X-rays on a possible broken ankle, although he was later found to have damaged ankle ligaments.

"The diagnosis on Jason is not so good, but he will be staying with us on tour," said coach Greg Smith. "I understand it is medial ligament damage in his knee, but I have been told it could just be a 10-day injury."
A haul of 27 points from full-back Matt Burke ensured the Australians won comfortably enough, despite a stuttering first-half display which saw them ahead just 13-11 at the interval.
Converted tries in the second-half from Tim Horan, Burke, Mark Connors and Sam Payne made the Scots pay for losing their concentration, although coach Smith was less than impressed.

"I was disappointed because of the amount of ball that was turned over, especially in the first-half. I can't make excuses for players. They should all be able to pass and catch the ball without dropping it."
Scotland A manager Doug Morgan felt several of his players could earn places in the full Scotland team to face the Wallabies on November 9.
